t: Job 29
Job’s Summary Defense
Job*p further continued his discourse, and said:
“Oh,*pn that I were as in*i months past, As*ld in*i the days when*i God watched over me;
When*ld His lamp shone upon my head, And*ild when*i by His light I walked through*i darkness;
Just*ld as I was in the days of my prime, When*ld the friendly counsel of God was*i over my tent;
When*ld the Almighty was*i yet with me, When*ild my children were*i around me;
When*ld my steps were bathed with cream, And*ld the rock poured out rivers of oil for me!
“When*ln I went out to the gate by the city, When*ild I took my seat in the open square,
The*ld young men saw me and hid, And*ld the aged arose and*i stood;
The*ld princes refrained from talking, And*ld put their*i hand on their mouth;
The*ld voice of nobles was hushed, And*ld their tongue stuck to the roof of their mouth.
When*ld the ear heard, then it blessed me, And*ld when the eye saw, then it approved me;
Because*ld I delivered the poor who cried out, The*ld fatherless and the*i one*i who*i had no helper.
The*ld blessing of a perishing man*i came upon me, And*ld I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
I*ld put on righteousness, and it clothed me; My*ld justice was*i like a robe and a turban.
I*ld was*i eyes to the blind, And*ld I was*i feet to the lame.
I*ld was*i a father to the poor, And*ld I searched out the case that*i I did not know.
I*ld broke the fangs of the wicked, And*ld plucked the victim from his teeth.
“Then*ln I said, ‘I shall die in my nest, And*ld multiply my*i days as the sand.
My*ld root is*i spread out to the waters, And*ld the dew lies all night on my branch.
My*ld glory is*i fresh within me, And*ld my bow is renewed in my hand.’
“Men*ild listened to me and waited, And*ld kept silence for my counsel.
After*ld my words they did not speak again, And*ld my speech settled on them as*i dew.*i
They*ld waited for me as*i for the rain, And*ld they opened their mouth wide as*i for the spring rain.
If*ild I mocked at them, they did not believe it,*i And*ld the light of my countenance they did not cast down.
I*ld chose the way for them, and sat as chief; So*ld I dwelt as a king in the army, As*ld one who*i comforts mourners.
